title: Apple’s full lineup of iPads is really really cheap for Prime Day
content:
Macworld

In case you didn’t know, Amazon’s second Prime Day of 2024 is here, and there are lots of Apple deals to be had. But if you’re looking for a new iPad mini, there’s never been a better time to buy. Amazon is running deep discounts on some of its most popular models.

First up is the iPad mini, down to $350, a whopping $150 off, and the lowest price we’ve ever seen. It may be a couple of years old, but it’s still a fantastic tablet, with a super-light design built around an 8.3-inch Liquid Retina display, an A15 processor, and a 12MP ultra-wide front camera. Weighing about a half-pound, it’s smaller and lighter than a book, and sturdy enough to cram into any bag or backpack.

There’s also the 10th-gen iPad, which is down to $299, $50 off its MSRP, and the best price we’ve ever seen. The 10th-gen iPad is Apple’s entry-level tablet, with a 10.9-inch display and an A14 processor. It’s also got Touch ID, in the power button, 64GB of storage, and a choice of several fun colors.

You can also save $150 on any iPad Pro once you check the $50 coupon box on these listings:

  • 11-inch M4 iPad Pro (512GB): $1,049 with coupon ($149 off, MSRP $1,199)
  • 13-inch M4 iPad Pro (256GB): $1,150 ($149 off with coupon, MSRP $1,299)
  • 13-inch M4 iPad Pro (512GB): $1,350 ($149 off with coupon, MSRP $1,499)

Speaking of the iPad Pro, there’s also a sale on the Apple Magic Keyboard. Amazon is selling the 11-inch Magic Keyboard for $249 ($50 off) and the 13-inch model for $318 ($31 off).

    Finally, if you really miss the Home button, the 9th-gen model with a 10.2-inch screen is down to $199. It’s been at this price for a while, but it’s still a great price for a very good tablet, with an A13 chip, and a 12MP Ultra Wide camera with Center Stage.

    So if you need a new tablet and want the best price, beat the Black Friday rush and grab one now before Prime Day ends tonight.
